title: Sting calls on Bruce Springsteen and John Mellencamp for benefit Concert hosted by Robert Downey Jr
text:
Music legend Sting and wife Trudie Styler have called on some major talent to perform at the 30th Anniversary Benefit Concert for their charity, The Rainforest Fund.

The concert dubbed We'll Be Together will feature a once in a lifetime line-up of icons like Bruce Springsteen and John Mellencamp among many others.

Oscar nominee Robert Downey Jr. will host the show at the Beacon Theatre in New York City on December 9.

Doing good: Music legend Sting and wife Trudie Styler have called on some major talent like Bruce Springsteen and John Mellencamp to perform at the 30th Anniversary Benefit Concert for their charity, The Rainforest Fund this December (Pictured: Sting and Trudie Styler at The Rainforest Fund's 2014 benefit concert)

The Rainforest Fund was co-founded by Sting, his wife Trudie Styler and Dr. Franca Sciuto back in 1989 and it's channeling the music of that time for this year's benefit.

MTV-era artists and songs from the eighties and nineties will provide the score for the evening which aims to raise money to protect the world's rainforests.

The charity is drawing inspiration from a time in pop culture history when music united for different causes through benefit concerts like Band Aid and Live Aid, as well as songs like We Are the World.

'The 1980s ignited a revolution of social change and awareness,' The Rainforest Fund said in a press release.

Your host this evening: Robert Downey Jr. will serve as the host of the night which aims to raise money to benefit the world's rainforests

A list! Bruce Springsteen and John Mellencamp will join Sting and other big names as performers for the anniversary concert titled We'll Be Together

'The power of the music video was captured by MTV, and opened up a whole new medium for audiences to connect with songs, artists and with global issues.'

Along with Sting, Bruce Springsteen and John Mellencamp the concert will feature performances by James Taylor, Bob Geldof, Shaggy, Ricky Martin, H.E.R., MJ Rodriguez and Eurythmics.

'With the Amazon blighted by fire this summer, and a real and growing awareness of climate change, there has never been a more important or more opportune moment to fight to protect our forests,' said Trudie Styler.

On stage: Along with Sting, Bruce Springsteen and John Mellencamp the concert will feature performances by James Taylor, Bob Geldof, Shaggy, Ricky Martin, H.E.R., MJ Rodriguez and Eurythmics (Pictured: Ricky Martin and MJ Rodriguez)

'With the Amazon blighted by fire this summer, and a real and growing awareness of climate change, there has never been a more important or more opportune moment to fight to protect our forests,' said Trudie Styler (Pictured: A fire blazes on in the Brazilian Amazon rainforest in September)

Adding pointedly: 'All life on earth depends on their survival.'

Styler is producing the concert and all proceeds will go directly 'to the protection and support of the Indigenous people and their land, for they are the best protectors of this vital element of our ecosystem.'

The Fund originally focused on the Amazon region of Brazil but has since expanded over the decades to aid the world's rainforests.

Ticket prices range from $206.00 to $586.00 and will be available beginning November 1 via Ticketmaster as well as at the Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall and Beacon Theatre box office on November 2.
